== Main Inclusion Report for papyon ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/p/papyon]]</nowiki>; Architecture: Alll
# ''Rationale:''
** Dependency of telepathy-butterfly, for MSN support in telepathy/empathy
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=papyon|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: None
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=papyon|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: None
** Any binaries running as root or suid/sgid ?  Any daemons ?
** Network activity: Does not use network directly (but talks to telepathy daemon which uses the network) 
** Data processing done by telepathy daemon
** Written in Python, thus no exploitable buffer overflows, etc.
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Just a library, works out of the box.
** No debconf
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:papyon|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: None
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/p/papyon.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is vigorous
** <nowiki>[[http://telepathy.freedesktop.org/wiki/Papyon|Upstream]]</nowiki> is vigorous
** <nowiki>[[https://bugs.freedesktop.org/buglist.cgi?quicksearch=papyon|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: Nothing frightening
** Does not need particular hardware
** No test suite (hard to do, needs server)
 0. ''UI standards:''
** No user-visible strings, it just implements protocol
** No desktop file, no application
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** debhelper 7 packaging system, no patches, clean packaging
# ''Dependencies:'' all in main
# ''Maintenance:''
** How much maintenance is this package likely to need ? Most likely none, done well by Debian
** Who is responsible for monitoring the quality of this package and fixing its bugs ?  Ubuntu desktop team
** Who is the package bug contact in Ubuntu? Nobody so far
 0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package should be clear from the package's debian/control file.
